description: From Middle English rispen, from Old Norse rispa (“scratch”), from Proto-Germanic *ripsōną (“to rend; rip; tear open”), from Proto-Indo-European *reyb- (“to tear; snatch; pluck; reap”). Compare also Old Norse rifsa (“to plunder; reave”).

verbs.description: risp (third-person singular simple present risps, present participle risping, simple past and past participle risped)

entries.meaning: To rub together, to rasp or grate.
